verb.description: Plan or invent (a complex procedure, system, or mechanism) by careful thought.
examples: a training program should be devised
a complicated game of his own devising

verb.description: Leave (real estate) to someone by the terms of a will.

noun.description: A clause in a will leaving something, especially real estate, to someone.

origin: Middle English: the verb from Old French deviser, from Latin divis- divided, from the verb dividere (this sense being reflected in the original English sense of the verb); the noun is a variant of device (in the early sense will, desire).
